name: Windsor Asturias Hotel

reviews.text: Thought the price of the room was a little high for what was offered. The rooftop view was nice, but the workout center was small and unappealing. The room was clean, but nothing too exciting. Location to Lapa is the best part and its nightlife close within walking distance. Helpful staff and speaks English. Breakfast buffet simple. You'll have to take approximately a R25 cab ride to get to Ipanema beach. WiFi is an extra charge.
reviews.title: Location to Lapa ideal

reviews.text: Great room, service, rooftop pool and bar with views, security. Good location with easy metro/bus access to everything if you are ok with being away from beaches. Decent breakfast.
reviews.title: Perfect if ok with not being at beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here only a couple of months ago, and found the hotel to be good value for the money. We came back for Carnival 2012 and chose this hotel for its central location. This proved to be a very good choice, as Centro and Cinelandia are party central for Carnival. Massive gatherings happen just around the corner from the hotel - either in the square in front of the Teatro Municipal or a block away in the shadows of the Arcos de Lapa. Loud music, cold beer and street stalls serving all kinds of food make for a very festive atmosphere. The hotel provides armbands as an added security measure indicating that you are in fact guests of the hotel. The sambadrome is only a short Metro ride away for whichever night you choose to attend the incredible "desfiles das escolas de samba". The rooftop bar and swimming pool are a great place to relax in the afternoon while preparing for another evening of celebration in the cidade maravilhosa. And bartender Leandro does make the finest caipirinhas. Through it all the hotel remains cool, comfortable, quiet and a safe oasis from the noise on the street outside.
reviews.title: A good hotel when in Rio for Carnival

reviews.text: Great location for carnivale if you like to party (near where many of the parties are but with good sound insulation) and the desk staff speak good English and are very helpful.
reviews.title: I have no idea why this place was 2 star - it was fantastic!

reviews.text: Can't recommend this hotel enough - and can't understand why it's so cheap. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. Other facilities were fine - breakfast was fine but it's south America - so if you expect much more than cheese and meat, you're on the wrong continent however there was still bacon, cereal and eggs.
reviews.title: Great place for a short stay in Rio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on the first night of our trip in Brasil. The hotel is centrally located in an area that felt quite safe at night. It's very near the theatre area and has some nice bars nearby.
reviews.title: Business like hotel in a central area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recption staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and a decent size, and the rooftop pool had a great view over Rio.
reviews.title: I liked the hotel!

reviews.text: Lapa (for bars and restaurants) is a 15 minute walk away but wouldn't recommend at night or alone.
reviews.title: Boring but pleasant, clean and convenient

reviews.text: My mother and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. We arrived early in the morning by an air france flight from Paris and the room wasn't ready for us. We went to beaches and came back around noon and were informed that the room was ready for us. The room was well decorated and comfortable. It's not big bit not to small. The view from the room is rather limited as it is blocked by other tall buildings in downtown Rio. The bathroom is fairly spacious. The hotel is very clean. The rooftop is small. I went to see the swimming pool, which is very small and there's a sauna next to it. I didn't use either the pool nor the sauna. From the top, you can see the Corcovado as well as the Sugar Loaf. We didn't take the tram to Santa Teresa though the station is within a walking distance from the hotel. The breakfast at the hotel was very good. Staffs are friendly. This is my second time in Rio and I am glad that I chose this hotel.
reviews.title: A decent hotel in centro of Rio

reviews.text: I stay 5d at this hotel, I had a good experience there, clean room, good breakfast, good rate for exchange. I just want to comment about noise level at the rooms, you can hear everything even the elevator engine and the shower of the others, I remembered a travel in a military submarine. The other fact is the expensive internet service, it must be free as the 99% of other hotels that I have hosted. Location is fine because Cinelandia metro station near.
reviews.title: Yellow submarine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Asturias is one of ten Windsor hotels in Rio, including three in centro, six in Copacabana, and one in Barra da Tijuca. This moderately priced hotel is in Cinelandia. It is very close to a Metro station, only one block from the financial heart of Rio in Avenida Rio Branco and but a short walk or cab ride from Santos Dumont airport. Rooms are clean, comfortable and nicely appointed. The wrap around rooftop terrace has a small swimming pool, gym, and bar for those afternoons when you don't feel up to fighting the crowds on Ipanema Beach. Enjoy fine vistas of Santa Teresa, the Arcos de Lapa and Flamengo Park. Staff are attentive and helpful, and may allow late checkout and baggage storage if you are catching a night flight home. Cafe de manha is excellent with service by white dinner jacketed/black bow tied waiters The downtown location of this 22 storey, 166 room hotel means the early morning roar of an awakening Rio de Janeiro will seep in through your windows. No matter. It's time to get up and on with another day in the cidade maravilhoso.
reviews.title: Centrally located in Cinelandia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not realize that, when travelling to Rio, Rock in Rio was going on, which explained the lack of available hotels. The Windsor Asturias was one of the very few, and, therefore, we decided to stay here. My impressions are as follows:
reviews.title: Good hotel in a grungy area

reviews.text: (a) location: only good if you have to do business downtown. We arrived on a Saturday evening, and we decided not to leave the hotel that night because the area is really dangerous on weekends and in the evenings (we had both things at the same time!). However, it is great if you want to visit some of the "historical" sites, and Lapa and the Bairro de Santa Teresa are just around the corner, and there is a conveniente metro station just around the corner, which goes directly to Copacabana and Ipanema;
reviews.title: New and well located

reviews.text: Stayed one night only on a flight stopover. Seemed nearest reasonable hotel to the GIG airport. R$80 and 35 minutes from the airport in RadioTaxi. 'Superior' double room was very good but basic, 18th floor, no noise issues. Good bathroom, big shower. Room, like the hotel, was quiet, clean, bland, a bit austere: basically a good business hotel. Very pleasant roof terrace and bar with city view including Cristo and Lapa arches: excellent when illuminated at night, not so impressive view of roofs in daylight. Drinks on the terrace slightly spoilt by cooking smells presumably from kitchen exhausts. Tiny pool. Good breakfast with plenty of selection. Reception staff very helpful - booked a car (nice car, not a taxi) to the airport for 7 am next day: R$60 and 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Basically all good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent place to stay: good staff, good breakfast, good transports links. The hotel is walking distance from Lapa, so is ideal for those that live the night. Also, lots of restaurants nearby much cheaper and with much more genuine flavour of Brazilian food than in “zona sul”.
reviews.title: Great for night life!

reviews.text: Pool and great view over the city on top floor.
reviews.title: Excellent cost/benefit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: 3 Star Hotel with 4/5 Star Staff

reviews.text: Although at first this hotel appears do be just "ok in a bad location", turns out that this is a very good one in a surprisingly good location. See comments below:
reviews.title: Great business hotel in Rio

reviews.text: I was very happy with my stay at the Windsor Asturias Hotel. I was in Rio for a week for business in Centro and it was perfect for what I needed. The location within a few steps of the Cinelandia Metro stop and ear shot of the party at Lapa was perfect for me. The area felt safe at all hours of the day and night. The bar, pool, and view from the top floor of the city and Cristo Redentor was impressive. Breakfast was OK, not great, but decent. The fitness room was spartan, small, and stuffy but suited my needs. My room was not overly luxurious but was clean, comfortable, and functional. I do recommend asking for a room on the highest floor possible away from the lifts (I brought earplugs and got great sleep). The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was able to book my room for a low price relative to other hotels in Rio. Overall, my week in Rio was absolutely fantastic and my experience at the Windsor Asturias was a big part of that. I would not hesitate to stay here again, although if in Rio only for leisure and having stayed in Centro already, I might look for a hotel closer to the beaches first (likely another Windsor property).
reviews.title: Excellent for what and where it is...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast OK
reviews.title: Meets all your requirements

reviews.text: The Windsor Asturias is in the Centro district (Cinelandia), a bit away from the beaches and general tourist crowd. What I really liked about this hotel is the friendly and professional service - it was not a problem to check in at 10am (after an overnight flight), and staff were very helpful. Great value too: only €108 per night, including breakfast (through Expedia). Other pros: it is clean and quiet. I had an 'executive' room with Jacuzzi as the other rooms were sold out.The rooms are rather sparsely furnished, small conveniences like a reading light or comfy chair would have been nice. The rooms come with a good safe, minibar (good prices), and WIFI is available, but quite expensive and slow. The hotel is in a fairly safe part of town, but is right next door to the (in)famous Lapa district where you can spend the whole night enjoying the crowds, food, music and drinks. Hotel is also only one street away from the Subway. The view from the roof top bar and terrace is great, but unfortunately the bar wasn't staffed at any of the nights I went up there.
reviews.title: Professional, safe and clean

reviews.text: Recently returned from business trip where stayed at this property. For my meetings...quite convenient, as was walking distance. However, being in Centro almost everything shuts down at end of business day so options for outside food and drink are limited. Breakfast buffet is of good value, but lunch and dinner prices are a bit steep given location, atmosphere and quality. Cost for internet seemed a bit out of touch for today's hotels - although may have been average for area. Room was smallish and sparse but comfortable. Elevators were spastic in that they like to stop on random floors. NO IRONING kit in room (fail) so any pressing needs to be sent out at quite an expense. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Rooftop bar/pool offers amazing views of city and mountains - hint...go up at sunset. TV offering was good. Windows open (nice).
reviews.title: Good for business...out of loop for sightseeing

reviews.text: Taxis to the beaches will run about $20-30 each way, depending on time and traffic.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: I recently stayed in this hotel this past weekend and I was pleased with everything. The neighborhood is not much to look at but it is close to other pretty areas. The subway is only 5 minutes away and it is on the mainline to all of the popular areas. If you don’t want to pay the high hotel prices that the pretty areas have then stay at Windsor Asturias. The hotel was nice inside and the staff was very friendly. My room was cozy and the shower was amazing. I could have stayed in the shower for hours. The hotel is close to some really good restaurants and you will actually run into a lot of locals at these eateries. Why go to another country to search out other tourist?
reviews.title: Good but needs a few small improvements
